messageBody:
Dear Mr. Avenger,

The (eventually) correct way to support this is to write your own runner and
annotate your class with @RunWith(MyTibcoRunner.class). This is an option at
the moment, but the runner classes, although published, are not easy to
specialize.

The least intrusive option is call a utility method inside your test:

@Test public void tibPrepare() {
String service= "7500";
prepare(service);
try {
...your test...
} finally {
terminate(service);
}
}

Hope this helps.

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of darkblueavenger
> Sent: Sunday, May 21, 2006 9:35 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] [Junit4] Extending jUnit 4 ...
>
> Hi guys,
>
> I wrote an open source extension module for JUnit 3 to test TIBCO
> Rendezvous (a messaging middleware) and I'm trying to port it
> to JUnit 4
> using the annotations.
>
> My basic requirement is that a method is called before and
> another after
> the execution of any given test method.
>
> For example:
>
> @TibPrepare(service = "7500")
> @Test
> public void tibPrepare() {
> ...
> }
>
> Where TibPrepare is my annotation. So my question is how do I
> tell jUnit
> 4 to invoke such and such a class/method?
>
> My initial thought was to extend TestDecorator however my
> issue is that
> I want this extension of jUnit to work everywhere, including in IDEs
> such as Intellij IDEA (the one I'm using, just an example).
>
> If I take IntelliJ, they appear to be using
> junit.textui.TestRunner and
> have defined their own callbacks (for example:
> com.intellij.rt.junit4.Junit4TestMethodAdapter.run is called by
> junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest)
>
> So I'm a bit stumped here on how to best implement a jUnit 4 extension
> that is always invoked whatever the environment (maven, ant,
> IDE such as
> IntelliJ or Eclipse).
>
> Any help would be appreciated, and I apologize in advance if the
> question has already been raised before, but I haven't found such a
> Topic in this list.
>
> Regards,
>
> Cedric.
